snippet: With investigators moving on multiple fronts, there is intense scrutiny on three brothers, living in Belgium, as key suspects in the elaborate plot.
abstract: Increasing number of clues related to terror attacks in Paris lead back to poor Brussels neighborhood of Molenbeek and three brothers who lived there; Ibrahim Abdeslam has been identified as one of suicide bombers, brother Mohamed is under arrest and third brother Salah is being sought, believed to have participated directly in attack and fled Paris; another suicide bomber, who is thought to have visited Syria, is identified as Ismael Omar Mostefai.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY, KATRIN BENNHOLD, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ADAM NOSSITER
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Paris, Katrin Bennhold from London, Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Adam Nossiter from Chartres, France. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt from Washington; Aurelien Breeden from Paris; Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from Brussels; and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.

lead_paragraph: With investigators moving on multiple fronts, there is intense scrutiny on three brothers, living in Belgium, as key suspects in the elaborate plot.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds Mounting Proof of Syria Link to Paris Attacks
headline.print_headline: Mounting Clues Point to Brothers and Trip to Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
